Abstract: PT. Nutricell Pacific is a private feed additive manufacturing industry located in Tangerang, where they implement barcode system in their production department for 10 months. They applied QR code as their products information storage. The main goal of this research is to evaluate the barcode system from the system perspective in the aspect of efficiency and effectiveness, identify the valid factors which affect the overall performance and find alternative solutions. Without official overall audits, the company could not detect the possible issue or technical improvements required. Hence, by using DeLone and McLean success model variables and system evaluation theory as the qualitative approach could find the potential elements and determine the current efficiency and effectiveness. Based on hypothesis testing, interviews and 15 respondent questionnaires, the findings of this research will reveal the factors which affect the worker’s performance in interacting with barcode system. The possible factors consist of system quality, information quality, user satisfaction and organization impact. Accordingly, through the methodology applied, the results certainly show the efficiency and effectiveness according to the workers and systems interaction lenses and not from the technical perspectives. Abstract: The development of information technology, which is followed by an increasingly high level of bank competition, encourages the banking or non-banking sector to be more innovative in providing various alternative non-cash payment services that are safe, fast and efficient, and are global in nature. With the increasing number of non-cash transactions from bank customers, a website design is needed to visualize customer non-cash transaction data. This study aims to design customer websites. Website design method used is the Waterfall method with several steps, like Communication (Project Initiation Requirement Gathering), Planning (Estimating, Scheduling, Tracking), Modeling (Analysis Design) and Construction (Code Test). The design produces a website for users. The website for visualizing customer noncash transaction data generated, it will make it easier for customers to see, analyze and control expenses made through visualizing customer non-cash transaction data. © 2020 IEEE.

Abstract: The government has made a regulation on development interventions for the region, the purpose of which is intended to enhance the properity of the community. In this case various development fields are targeted by the central government which is carried out by the regional government up to the level of government at the village level. The development is to help the community in many sectors, especially for the poor. Many attempts have been conducted by government; however, the results are not optimal and not meeting the right target. This study has the intention to provide a decision support application for village level government based on Geographic Information Systems (GIS), which aims to facilitate development decision making in the region. This application is designed with a GIS approach, observation, discussion, literature studies and analyzing system with UML are conducted in this research. The result is dashboard of business intelligence based on GIS expected to be able to provide data support both geographically and tabularly so that program implementation is more targeted. © 2020 IEEE.

Abstract: This paper aims to study the need for village spatial and tabular databases based on village neighborhood and territory association (RT / RW) and the role of them in data development and rejuvenation. It will support proper and improve interventions in development programs, public services, and village government administration. Community participation is expected to support the improvement of RT / RW maps and monitoring the implementation of programs and administration of the village government. The research was carried out through the study of regulations relating to village tasks and functions, empowerment and community welfare programs, availability of data, and information technology that can be utilized, particularly Geographic Information System (GIS) and electronic databases. The study consisted of the stages of digitizing building ownership using satellite imagery data, field surveys of ownership verification, compilation of geospatial databases (joining attribute tables with spatial), and the development of GIS dashboards. © 2020 IEEE.

Abstract: As the millennial era strikes in, smart industries or known as industry 4.0 is a wide spoken topic in the world of industries. By the concerns of Indonesia upon several arise issues, this paper present a pre-study of the Geographical Information System (GIS) approaches to dwell in the Industrial sector specified in the Oil Gas Industry. As industry 4.0 constitutes a new operations system, adjustments and new mindset are integrated to enhance the industry process. Pertamina Hulu Mahakam had collaborated with GIS to improve its technological processes and monitoring activities. By using a gap analysis and systematic literature review, the results will illustrate the mapping analysis protruding the data integration and ownerships which has been the concern of the government in Indonesia. Using ArcGIS online, the tools ease the visualization and creation of the proposed map design to show an efficient mapping of the oil gas industries. Accordingly, some current issues, challenges, and proposed solutions are mentioned and limitations mentioned are recommended for peer further research purposes. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: At present the tourism sector is growing and getting considerable attention from the government. Promotion and marketing have been carried out by business people in the tourism sector through the delivery of cultural delegations as well as through global internet communication networks. This research aims to implement web tourism collaboration. This website is implemented for the purpose of disseminating information about tourism products and also to attract as many tourists as possible to visit tourism destinations through one information path. This paper aims to look at the potential use of web and data communication technologies currently available to enhance digital tourism promotion and promotion. In this study the location and sample used were Semarang Municipality, Central Java Province. Several methods are used in this study, namely literature studies, studies of tourism legislation documents and field surveys, as well as Forum Group Discussions to implement. Implementation methods using Apache MQ, web services and API. The result is a collaboration website that can influence the increasing number of tourists visiting the province with easy information access. © 2019 IEEE.

Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Qing, C.H.G., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Oktaviani, E., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Heripracoyo, S., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this literature review is to identify the importance Geographical Information System (GIS) and Industrial 4.0 roles in enhancing manufacturing industry in near future. As the industrial 4.0 concepts has revolved and visible components have surfaced, this paper will use a systematic literature review methodology to assert the crucial elements of manufacturing industries in GIS and Industrial 4.0 concepts for providing a resolution in improving manufacturing industries. In addition, Arcgis online would be used to create a visualization of the proposed map design that shows the potentiality to solve current concerns of manufacturing industries in Bekasi. Along with the evolution of industrial 4.0, it is crucial to grasp on the idea on how to wisely integrate GIS and manufacturing industry location data in-order to track industries sites and monitor activity data ubiquitously. We conclude the analytical elements supported by the evidence and also a proposed map design which could aid the complex decision making and site location tracking of manufacturing industries in Indonesia. By doing this research, the motivation is to convince GIS contribution to manufacturing industry evolution, there are more reasons and evidence to implement GIS to adapt to the current developing industrial 4.0. For further research purposes, this prestudy is the initiation of manufacturing future foresight. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: GIS-Based Business Intelligence (BI) for People Welfare Intervention Program Case Study: Pekalongan City
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adi, S., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Heripracoyo, S., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Irwansyah, E., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Many programs oriented to people's welfare are aimed at helping non-prosperous families, poor in the fields of education, health, and food with the same target, namely poor families. This program is planned, implemented, directed and supervised by the government so that the program's objectives are in line with the targets, namely poverty reduction. Many efforts have been made but the impact of this program has not been optimal, one of the reasons is the unavailability of object target data for these programs that state who the poor are and where they live for the basis of program intervention so that implementation is not on target as well as the realization report. The purpose of this paper is to design a Business Intelligence (BI) application that is able to provide such data so that program interventions are in line with the objectives. Development methodology is designed using Geographical Information System (GIS) approach yang which consists of stages of data acquisition (spatial and tabular data) at various levels of administration, geodatabase design and WebGIS applications as well as spatial analysis. The GIS BI will be very helpful in the decision-making process to support the planning and implementation of programs that require the accuracy of the object or target of the program. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: This paper aims at examining the effect of cloud computing and big data management on innovation capabilities with particular reference to the context of digital creative industries. For that purpose, both qualitative and quantitative methods were applied in the study. Accordingly, quantitative data were gathered from an empirical survey as well as qualitative data gathered from focus group discussions. The results provide a descriptive data in the implementation of cloud computing and big data management as well as innovation capability and performance in the digital creative industry. Statistical analysis shows that cloud computing, big data management, and innovation capability simultaneously affect the company's performance significantly. However, there was no significant effect, either simultaneously or partially, of cloud computing and big data management on innovation capability. This study provide a benchmark of how the management of information technology can influence the implementation direction of cloud computing and big data management in the digital creative industries’ innovation capability. The findings also provide a new knowledge in a literature on performance improvement in the digital creative industries. © BEIESP.

Title: Village Business Intelligence (BI) Design to Support Social Welfare Intervention Programs by Using GIS Approach

Abstract: Currently the development of rural communities in Indonesia is becoming a priority with the aim of increasing social welfare. Education, health, and food are the three main points of concern to the government, besides unemployment, business opportunities, infrastructures, and village economics. The target is villagers and their communities. Today there are mainly three interventions of village development programs in education (Indonesia Smart Card), health (Indonesia Health Card) and food (Household Food Program) that supported by macro data only. Data on the number of villagers requiring education, health, food and data of village potential resources are available, but who and where they are cannot be known. Furthermore, at the village level, there is no such decision-making tools and no data that specifically refer to the object so that program interventions are often not targeted. The purpose of this paper is to design a database and application of village Business Intelligence (BI) by utilizing the GIS advantage to assist village officials and other government officials for decision making processes in the intervention of village community welfare development program. The methods used are literature studies of village legislation, surveys, and interviews. The result of this research is the design of dashboard including database and applications. © 2018 IEEE.

Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adi, S., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Heripracoyo, S., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Promotion and marketing has been done by the business actors in the field of tourism through the delivery of cultural delegations as well as through the global internet communication network. At the provincial level, almost all tourism business actors such as hotels, tourist destinations, and tourism travel bureaus, have websites to support promotional activities and marketing of tourism products. The website was developed for the purpose of disseminating information on Indonesian tourism products and attracting tourists as much as possible to visit tourism destinations. Currently tourism websites are generally built apart from each other so that sometimes inform the same tourism products but not complete and not support each other. Nevertheless the existence of the website has not been optimal in boosting the increase in the number of tourists visiting Indonesia, even when compared with neighboring countries the number of foreign tourists who come to Indonesia is still relatively low. The current information technology enables collaboration between websites so as to increase the chance of tourism information access for potential tourists both at home and abroad and impact on the increase of tourist visit. This paper aims to see the potential use of web and data communications technologies currently available to enhance the promotion and promotion of digital tourism. The method used is literature study, document study of tourism legislation and field survey to study the potential utilization of information and communication technology relevant to collaboration model and its implementation. The expected result is the recommendation of the strategy of tourism websites development and their implementation of collaboration at the provincial level so as to have an impact on the increasing number of tourists visiting the province. © IAEME Publication

Title: Tourism business web integration with web services
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Heripracoyo, S., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Adi, S., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Indonesia has a lot of tourism objects. Tourist visits from year to year have increased, but still below the number of countries in Southeast Asia. Under these conditions, the government, especially the tourism office needs to conduct a collaboration to maintain and increase the growth of the number of tourists visiting Indonesia. This study aims to integrate information services from other parties who collaborate to support tourism activities, especially collaboration at the provincial level. Related parties are the Tourism office, hotel, Travel & Tourism Agent and Tourism Destination. The integration of information is intended to facilitate access to information by tourists in accordance with their needs. Observation, literature study and information system integration design were used in this study. Observations were conducted at the tourism office and tourism destination in three different locations to obtain the needed information in Semarang, Surabaya and Yogyakarta. UML Modeling is used for system analysis and development. A prototype of information integration is generated, which can be used to integrate information between tourism office, hotel, Travel & Tourism Agent and tourism destination. With the Integration of such information each party will obtain a marketing benefit, income and other benefits economically. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Model of measuring the influence of Knowledge Management system to IT complaints, case study in telecomunication company

Abstract: The purpose of this study is to investigate the best practices in the transdisciplinary field of knowledge management system implementation and measurement of IT Complain in a telecommunication company (PT Telkomsel). This paper examines three variables of Knowledge Management (People, Process and Technology) and IT Complain Variable. This research used two methods such as a qualitative and quantitative method. Qualitative methods of interviewing and observation and quantitative method by gave a questionnaire to respondent. As for analysis research used descriptive and verificative method. The goal of this research will be used to know how useful the role and influence of the knowledge management system for customer complaint. This paper is intended to provide a model to measure the effect of Knowledge Management to IT complain especially in Telecommunication Company. © 2016 IEEE.

Title: Effect of cloud computing and information technology capability to innovation capability, case study in digital creative industry

Abstract: This research to study digital creative industry which implements cloud computing and information technology. Based on the change of computing in new model that are cloud computing and information technology, they affected the investment in information technology that is move from capital expenditure to operation expenditure. Creative industries in Indonesia growth 400 new startup with revenue in IDR 2 Trillion. According to that background, this study conducted with a study of literature, interview, observation and survey. The data collected by questionnaire. Sample in this research is the digital creative industries. The data analysis using analysis statistic. The result of the data analysis is descriptive data and result of hypothesis. Purpose of this research is to create new knowledge for the creative industry with a model to support the complete information for the digital creative industries, especially for the digital creative industry that capable to arrange the firm management. © 2017 American Scientific Publishers All rights reserved.

Title: Big data management prototype development for analysis various of data

Authors with affiliations: Heripracoyo, S., Department of Information Systems, School of Information Systems, Binus University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: —The phenomenon of big data is currently a growing topic in the world of information technology. From some of the literature mentioned that manage big data can create significant value for the world economy, improving productivity and competitiveness of enterprises and the public sector as well as creating a large economic surplus for consumers. However, from some of the information obtained, big data is still not widely applied in the company or organization. This study aimed to explore more information about the big data and proceed with making an application prototype big data management. To experiment with big data storage that is database, this research use NoSQL database technology that can map the needs of both structured and unstructured. And this research will be carried out migration of Relational Database (RDBMS) into the database MongoDB. Prototype will be create with the object of study is structured and unstructured data. The expected result of this research is a model or prototype of big data management that can help organizations and companies (especially education) to make decisions based on various types of data. © 2015, Institute of Advanced Engineering and Science.
